intro: Eupatorium hebes, commonly known as the New Zealand chathamia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Eupatorium hebes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
